alert.note: Alert for Escambia Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:21AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Monroe, south central Choctaw, north central Baldwin, central Washington, Clarke, western Escambia and northwestern Escambia Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 420 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Jackson to 12 miles northwest of Uriah to McCullough to near Bratt. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atmore, Jackson, Frisco City, Grove Hill, Chatom, McCullough, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Uriah, Whatley, Tibbie, Coffeeville, Fulton, Bratt, I65 And CR 1, I65 And AL 21 and Poarch Creek Reservation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
